website_summaries.verdict: One of the most powerful inflators available on the market today.
pros: A long air hose provides extra reach and makes up for the compressor's lack of mobility
Tough motor adds years of service
cons: Hard to store when not in use

customer_reviews.title: Darn Stiff Coiled Hose
customer_reviews.text: FOLLOW UP: After using this toy twice, I can state that screwing the end-fitting on to the valve stem is NOT the easiest...especially with the stiff coiled hose. I fixed that problrmme, mes amours, with the addition of a Milton S-684-4 1/4" NPT Tank Valve AND a Coilhose Pneumatics CH10 Closed Ball Chuck and Clip, 1/4-Inch FPT
customer_reviews.author: Amélie Renoncule

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Betware - Goodyear use a proprietary air hose fitting so you can't use industry standard air tool accessories
customer_reviews.text: Not a big fan of this unit. They use a proprietary air hose fitting so you can't use standard air tool accessories. This limits its usefulness and the way they attach the air hose to the compressor makes it impossible to unscrew the hose and replace with a standard air hose.

customer_reviews.title: Handles RV And Large SUV Tires With Ease
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use with my motorhome. Most portable tire pumps are useless with RV tires. I had a puncture and was able to inflate a 235/85 R16 tire from completely flat to 70 psi in about 8 minutes, with a 2 minute rest to prevent overheating of the pump - so, 10 minutes total. (If you think that is too slow, compare that to the 3 hour wait for a tow truck the Highway Patrol officer told me I was in for.) Then I was on the road again. VERY pleased with the performance. This is the 110 volt ac unit and is probably much stronger than any 12 volt dc unit.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M. Slover

customer_reviews.title: Dead motor - Good Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Lasted for one soccer ball, then the motor died. ****UPDATE***** So the product itself was useless the first time around, however, customer service did get back to me and is sending me a replacement with no questions asked other than proof of purchase. So at minimum, even if this thing is junk, at least the company stands behind the product. Most of the customer service for items I buy off Amazon is pretty lousy, so it has been refreshing to get helped out without it being a huge hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: and after 30 minutes of noise had pretty much nothing inflated
customer_reviews.text: Bought at the end of summer last year for use this summer on the lake. First time out of the box, read directions, hooked it up, plugged it in and turned it on, put the hose into an water float toy, and after 30 minutes of noise had pretty much nothing inflated. It's either defective or a crummy product. Obviously my fault for not checking it when we first got it. I'd stay away but if you get one, try it out immediately on the stuff you want to inflate. Also, it's labeled a "tire inflator" yet with the attachments provided, there is no way to actually inflate a tire. Very weird.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a hot minute and then started to crumble literally
customer_reviews.text: Used this about 6-7 times since I’ve owned it and very disappointed as everything is breaking down. 1st to go was the rubber seal around the gauge and soon after the cigarette lighter plug just disintegrated into little pieces. With exposed wires just hanging loose I managed to wrap electrical tape around the plug and with some wiggling of the broken plug would sometimes get lucky and it would work. It was hit or miss with the state the plug was in but when it worked and everything was intact it worked well. Very disappointed as I’m going to have to buy another one as I’m past the return date.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Pinto

customer_reviews.title: The connector to the tire  valves will fall apart after a few uses.
customer_reviews.text: It's fairly quiet and appears to build pretty good pressure. I used mine maybe 3 or 4 times and the little pin in the hose end that depresses the tire valve showed up missing! That seems to be a very common defect with this thing and that's why a number of buyers have suggested what they have done to resolve it. I wish someone would suggest a solution to allow me to use my defective one with my dual rear wheel pickup truck. It only takes 60 psi per tire, but you cannot use this on either of the rear wheels on my truck.
customer_reviews.author: DavidAllen44

customer_reviews.title: ... it's built solid and it's quite powerful it very useless for inflating bike tires
customer_reviews.text: Even though it's built solid and it's quite powerful it very useless for inflating bike tires. Even automotive tires are pain to inflate because the end connector is threaded forcing you to screw on the connector to the valve which does not work with bicycle tires very well as you lose a lot of pressure trying to disconnect it. The other problem is that the "quick connect" adapter is not standard - your air compressor accessories won't work with it so you are forced to use the terrible connector that ships with this pump. After 3 months of use I am looking for another compressor as this one does not do a good job inflating any kind of tires.
customer_reviews.author: Piotr A. Fraczek

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but has a few minor issues
customer_reviews.text: It does the job. However... * After having it for 4 years the ground pin on the cord came out ! I was pulling it out of an extension cord at the time and it stayed behind. * It can be tricky to screw the end onto the tire valve. I don't have big hands so I imagine it would be even more difficult for someone with larger hands, especially on a cold day. * It can be a bit slow when filling a car tire. It gets very hot and you have to let it cool down (e.g. between tires if filling more than one).
customer_reviews.author: luckyluke

customer_reviews.title: High quality, heavy-duty pump
customer_reviews.text: This is a high quality, heavy-duty air pump that met my needs/expectations. The pressure gauge seems accurate and it fills my truck tires far faster than cheaper pumps I've used. The air nozzle has a metal flap that clamps the nozzle onto the fill stem and this flap was really hard to operate compared to what I'm used to. Perhaps its just new? I bought the recommended alternate filler tip (see other reviews) so the stiff clamp isn't a problem. My only 'con' on this is that it's pretty heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Weak air pressure
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to quickly add air to our car tires, especially in the winter. My thought process was that this would be more powerful than the one I have that plugs into the cigarette lighter outlet in the car. It is not. The air pressure is pretty weak if you need it for cars. It may be fine for bikes and balls but since I have a hand pump, that's much quicker than going through the assembly of this unit. If you need it for balls and bike tires, this might work fine for you but I don't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Ron S.

customer_reviews.title: Does that job - but you have to do a lot to it to make it usable for bikes.  Didn't see any competitors that provided all though
customer_reviews.text: Really cheap quality. If you want to just pump bicycle tires, they need to put a standard air compressor nib on the end of it. Had to go out and buy one and after slashing hoses and wrangling hose clamps - finally got it together. Then I purchased two separate trigger tips with pressure gauges - presta and schrader before I finally put together what I was trying to accomplish. The gauge on the unit is entirely useless. You can forget pumping up a car tire with it. Air pressure way too low. And for bikes - you have to pray really hard that the bead is going to pop into place
customer_reviews.author: bbIsGr8Top Contributor: Baseball

customer_reviews.title: Misleading product description!
customer_reviews.text: The rubber protector on the valve connector is freely twisting and does not hold the connector tight enough to be able to screw it on the valve. The advertised "powerful direct drive motor is extremely quite and virtually vibration free" is misleading. The motor is not silent at all. It is rather noisy.
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: Dont waist your Time or Money folks!
customer_reviews.text: Save your money folks. This is a joke. How come there is no Tire chuck with this compressor? What is this hollow black plastic piece for. What a piece of junk. Will be shipping this back to Amazon as soon as possible. It's a shame I had to give it one star.
customer_reviews.author: John Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Hard to operate for inflating tires
customer_reviews.text: I bought this inflator primarily to top up car tires when they need air. The hose for inflating car tires has a screw-on attachment that is covered by a plastic grip. Nice idea -- but the grip slips on the screw-on attachment to the point that it is difficult to get onto a tire valve without letting out a lot of air and equally difficult to get off a tire valve without letting out a lot of air. The net effect of all that is that I have to overinflated the tires by a fair amount and then bleed air out to get to the desired pressure. That is basically unsatisfactory. It may be fine for other applications.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, no quality assurance
customer_reviews.text: This product is not well constructed - nor is it well manufactured. Upon arrival, the charging port had come loose from its mounting position. Amazon refunded my money - and said I could do with it as I please ... so I took it apart and was able to repair the loose charging port. However, what I found inside was that the 2 compressor mounts were both broken - with no hope of repair - and this is before I've ever used the product. Poor quality, no quality assurance.
customer_reviews.author: Donn Baumgartner

customer_reviews.title: Absurdly low pressure. Nozzles don't fit snug.
customer_reviews.text: Junk. From the get go the pressure was absurdly low. The nozzles don't fit well, its very noisy and it takes FOREVER to inflate anything. We were trying to inflate a toddler pool and half hour later it was a quarter of the way filled. My dad finally ran home(since he lives near by) and got a cheap one he bought for $15 that's a quarter of the size of this one with no gauge or anything, It filled the pool the last 60% in 2 minutes. I may have gotten a lemon, but I would avoid this.
customer_reviews.author: B.K. Burris

customer_reviews.title: Super All Around Utility Compressor.
customer_reviews.text: I noted a note on another review about having to screw and unscrew the tire connection and that it lost pressure. I took off the black cover and can assure you that your won't loose anymore air than with a conventional compressor. Bought to clear blocked windshield washers. Blew out the trash in nozzles and unplugged filter block in pump. When blowing back through the pump put hose in canister to allow debris to flush. It does all that I want and more. Noisy, but to me that is normal.
customer_reviews.author: Bob M

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: This this is not a cheap electric pump, it's made of metal and not plastic so chances of this wearing in the near future. It;s the perfect pump to have is you own a lawn tractor, those thing always seem to have leaky tires.Easy to read gauge so over inflating is not a problem. I would recommend this to my friend, he's got one of those cheap plastics one's that only seem to last a few years before the pump leaks so bad it won't inflate anything.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A.

customer_reviews.title: Too much work!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, it DOES inflate my wheelchair tires, given the very poor designed screw-on/not push-on inflator valve! It often looses more air in screwing the valve on & off than with inflation; thus one must super inflate the tire to compensate for the loss. I can’t yet find a snap-on extension that has the Proper push-on to inflate my tires! I “tire” of this product 😩 !
customer_reviews.author: Peter A. Kunz

customer_reviews.title: Quality, Timeliness, Value
customer_reviews.text: Just got it - it is a solid little machine of very good quality at a good price delivered quickly. I spend a fair amount of time checking a small air compressor out both online and on amazon - read reviews - look at the negatives, wanted it to work but not overdo my infrequent need, etc... and picked this one. I needed to quickly blow out some water lines in an RV with sub zero weather approaching, My RV dealer was booked to Xmas so I ordered this. Got here in time and, sure enough, blew out the water in my water lines. whew ? thanks - - if anything untoward happens will update
customer_reviews.author: Tom S

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Works well to keep your car tires inflated. Comes with fittings to blow up other things. I didn't have much trouble with removing it from the valve stem, but I can't see the reason for such a long hose, when you would want to have the pressure gauge nearby anyway. The biggest problem I have with it is that said gauge doesn't read accurately during the process. Nevertheless, it fills tires efficiently and I usually overfill and use a tire gauge to let air out anyway. The main thing is that I can do it at home.
customer_reviews.author: be serious

customer_reviews.title: Product died with a few months. Not satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Lookz very well built. Only used for 4 or 5 times since I bought it in May. And last month this compress died. Looks like the motor burned out or something but it was hot. Pro: Light Output tube to the sterm is perfect size, not too short and not long where its a hassle wrapping it back for storage. Con: not the standard lock on to fill the air tire. Requires you to twist and twist the nozzle to the sterm. The builtin handle to help twist the nozzle doesnt work that welll and ends up kinking up the line.
customer_reviews.author: RockyThao

customer_reviews.title: Not enough thought by product management
customer_reviews.text: I would give this 5 stars except for the fact it comes with only a screw on chuck which is a very tight fit on motorcycles. I also see people saying to buy a 6mm chuck and splice it into the hose. Well I tried it an now have a useless hose. 6mm is to big for the non-standard hose that comes with this unit. Too bad! Update: a 3/16 barb is what you need for this hose. I found a 3/16 barb to 1/4 NPT that works and I can screw on a 1/4 air chuck.
customer_reviews.author: John Mckenney

customer_reviews.title: Quality unit, and 120v.
customer_reviews.text: A really nice little compressor with a lot of accessories. I'm using it to pump up my Air Lift units on my truck. I've had to seek out an air supply before on long trips, when I do a lot of hitching and unhitching of a 5th-wheel trailer, and thus inflating/deflating the Air Lifts. Finding an air supply on the road these days is like finding a source of water for your camper. Nobody just gives away anything as valuable as air or water anymore. BTW, I tried using a 12v compressors before to do this job, with poor results. My truck (Ram) has a 120v outlet on the dashboard, and it handles this compressor quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Nomdeploom

customer_reviews.title: IT JUST DIED!
customer_reviews.text: My return window to return this closed on August 10th, and I used the pump for the second time today which is August 28, 2019...it JUST DIED!!! So now I'm out $52!!! I would suggest that you do NOT buy this because it doesn't last. The only thing I have aired up has been playground balls. The company will only give me a comparable replacement for this. I'm not too happy today!!!
customer_reviews.author: grandmawe

customer_reviews.title: A great pump
customer_reviews.text: I am really happy I got this pump. It is not particularly loud, but it is powerful, and the rubber feet keep the pump from walking all over the floor (or off my workbench). The coiled hose makes it easy to reach the valve of whatever it is you're inflating. The product seems really well made so far, and the included accessories mean I expect to use it on everything from car tires to pool toys for a very long time to come.
customer_reviews.author: Mike S

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Most of the parts are plastic and thin plastic at that. It doesn't seem durable. It is hard to use to inflate bicycle tires because it does not have a flip-down apparatus to hold it in place. Maybe this attachment just didn't come with this purchase. For the price I paid, I would expect more power and less time to fill the tires. My sister has a different product for half the price and her tires fill in half the time!!! I would not recommend this product to others.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine M.

customer_reviews.title: Dead battery
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Good Year Inflator 5000 I have bought. The first one worked well but after 2 years the battery went dead. Thought that must be a fluke so I bought another one. This time the battery lasted 2 1/2 years. These are throw away inflators which work well for a time then go bad.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Nice air pump with two flaws
customer_reviews.text: I have used this a few times and like it, despite a couple of flaws. One is that the connection to the tire is screw-on. So, you lose some air when unscrewing it. The other is that the gauge is small and analog, therefore hard to read. Other than that, it's a great little pump. Does the job quickly and quietly.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Terrific little compressor for bike or auto tires.
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific compact 120 volt compressor for inflating tires and inflatable items at home. It's easy to use, relatively quiet and very fast. The built-in air Guage is easy to read accurate. It's small enough to take along on road trips: just bring along a 12 foot extension cord to reach the nearest outside electric receptacle at your destination. It's built in cord is long enough to reach the nearest outlet in many cases even without an extension cord and it's coiled hose easily stretches another 6 feet.
customer_reviews.author: Terry E. Simms

customer_reviews.title: Always double check with different gage
customer_reviews.text: The pressure gauge is not accurate at all, I never rely on those but still would like it to be somewhat close. I used pump to adjust air pressure on home pressure tank for hot water heater had to raise PSI to 61 from 60 it took a while because gauge would say 65 check with different gage it says 60.5 do it again it reads 63 let it run extra time took it up to 62. It's a good small easy to move around pump just always check with different gage.
customer_reviews.author: checkthat

customer_reviews.title: 1 year warranty-expensive junk
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this unit 3 years ago, used it only fewer than a dozen times inflating balls and perhaps topping up a couple tires constantly, kept it plugged into the charging unit as per instructions, and yesterday it wouldn't run. The light came on but it was dead. Expensive, Cheap junk battery.
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Goodyear i8000 120-Volt Direct Drive Tire Inflator
customer_reviews.text: Wonderfully compact and rugged! I was tired of NiCad batteries dying and wanted something I could plug in for on demand action. Product comes with an attachment for anything that requires inflation. I first used it on my car tires. I was skeptical, thinking it would not have enough power. I was wrong. Don't let the compact size fool you. It took longer to remove my tire caps and screw down the PVC air hose than to fill my tire. Fast and efficient. Their claim of "0 - 28 PSI in approximately 2 1/2 minutes or less" is accurate. And there is plenty of electrical cord and air hose to reach where needed. Absolutely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Espana

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to avoid using a model that runs off the cars cigarette lighter now phone charger. This unit runs off house current and has worked well now for a couple years. Fairly quiet, the gauge is accurate and the build quality is decent. I didn't do any extensive investigation before buying this brand/model but it does the job well enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: Backcast

customer_reviews.title: THE LITTLE GIANT
customer_reviews.text: You might think that this cute little item is just for pumping air into basketballs, footballs, beachballs or bicycle tires but NOOOOOO, It does even more than I expected it to do. While working outside yesterday I noticed one of my van tires was almost flat. Being the only compressor I have I hooked it up to the 275 R15 Goodyear tires and said, let's give it a try. Within just a few minutes it had pumped almost fifty pounds of air into the tire and was pretty impressed with its performance. So guess what. I highly recommend this unit. It's small for storage. Lightweight, fairly quiet and definitely does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Carnagie Thornhill

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade That Went Well
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this a few months ago to replace one I’ve one that had served me well for over 20 years. With the first cold snap this week, I was able to actually test it out on the car tires. It worked perfectly. The pump is smaller, lighter, and quieter than my old one. What I really appreciated was the pump actually screws on the valve stem so I don’t have to hold it in the perfect position.
customer_reviews.author: KVKinCLT

customer_reviews.title: It only last two uses
customer_reviews.text: I got this item on time. I didn't use it until a week later. It was great when I used it first two times. I was so happy until it started not working when I used it the third time. It didn't make any sound when I connected it to the tire. I tried with different extension cord, unplug it and re-plug it. I really needed it to pump my tire, but I was stuck, it just won't work. I don't have time to wait to return or exchange, so my husband had to go to local auto shop to get an adopter so that I can get tire pumped.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Enthusiastically Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I have had the i8000 GoodYear tire pump for several years; outstanding product, But most importantly is the warranty and the honor of the Company that stands behind this product. Should you have an issue, they will take care of you. If you need this device, you can purchase it without hesitation. Enthusiastically recommended. Shout out to Yvonne in customer service for her help, professional manner and kindness.
customer_reviews.author: UbiMea

customer_reviews.title: fast and accurate pump
customer_reviews.text: I finally has the need to used it. As advertise, it puts out a good volume of air to inflate the tire quite fast.hopefully it will last but I have only use it once. I also tested the pressure gauge against 2 other gauges and it is accurate. remember that when the weather get colder or hotter, the approximate ratio is that the tire pressure gains (in hot weather) or loses (in cold weather) pressure or about 1 lb per 10 degrees Fahrenheit
customer_reviews.author: AGM

customer_reviews.title: Find a better one
customer_reviews.text: Hmmm. The one I got had a very short air hose-- perhaps 16 inches. (gosh was that awkward - I had to hold the pump in the air while using) It looks like they improved this. I had a hard time using (read hate) the screw in connection for the tire stem. The clamp on ones are sooooo much better and faster (IMO). It was so hard to use I gave it to Good Will as my time to return it was gone.
customer_reviews.author: Inquiring mind KJ

customer_reviews.title: Fortunately, I contacted the seller and they sent me ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a really handy tool for keeping your tires at optimum inflation. We check our car tires every other week, and it was a pain to stop at the gas station to fill them. This is a bit pricey, but it's worth the time saved. A word of caution: the little pin in the tire chuck can be delicate. The first one that we had broke within a few weeks. You can't replace just the nozzle - you have to get a whole new (blue) hose. Fortunately, I contacted the seller and they sent me a new hose free of charge. The new one is working just fine, so maybe I just got a faulty part the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Marie T.

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Pump
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT. Only reason not giving it 5 stars is because of the cheap plastic accessories. If you are like me, you are inflating bike tires, car tires, soccer balls, or pool toys almost all summer long. I knew I needed something to make life easier. That is where this came in. This is always plugged in, always on my workbench and always ready to go. The hose reaches most parts of the garage area needed and if not, it is easy to tote to where it is needed. You will not be sorry buying this... right after you pitch the plastic parts into the trash.
customer_reviews.author: MyReviewMyStory

customer_reviews.title: Very Quiet and has screw-on connector rather than clip for bikes
customer_reviews.text: This is so much more quiet than our old "Slime" compressor. The pump is easy to carry (not too big), and it doesn't jump around when pumping. The connector for bike-sized pumping is a screw-on rather than a clip and pinch connector. The "pool toy" inflator attachment works okay. I thought this would pump out a lot more power than our little air mattress pump, and it does, but just not tons more. However, for littler jobs such as tire inflation for a bike, it's 2 to 3 times faster than our old "Slime" air compressor.
customer_reviews.author: Artoo

customer_reviews.title: I especially like the screw-on connector
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I had hoped for. Solid, versatile, well-engineered. I especially like the screw-on connector. While some reviews were critical of this design choice over a clip on connector, I find that it works better, especially for motor vehicle tires (the clip on hose of other pumps have a greater risk of snapping at the connector). This is an excellent, high quality product of 5+ stars, and at a fair and reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Berges

customer_reviews.title: Not quick, but does the job
customer_reviews.text: Works well on our car and bike tires. It's a little slow and quite noisy, but it's good to have on hand. I would have given five stars if -- 1 - it had a quick-release chuck (it comes with a screw-end chuck which ALWAYS loses air when disconnecting.) 2 - it had a storage container for the extra inflator ends (they're small and easily lost.) 3 - the pressure gauge was more accurate (mine is off by about three pounds)
customer_reviews.author: aerolark

customer_reviews.title: A Must for Your Garage
customer_reviews.text: Over the years, I've owned and used several plug-into-the-cigarette-lighter type tire inflators. This Goodyear unit is superior in every way, except that it's not going to be of much help if you're out on the road. Inflation is fast, the PSI dial is accurate and easy to read, the hose is sufficiently long, and the attachments are helpful for inflating more than just tires. One of the better Amazon purchases I've made!
customer_reviews.author: JPfromOH

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: So far I've only used it to inflate car tires but it does a nice job. I got tired of checking tire pressure at the gas station and having to wait as someone else used the air pump or some bonehead vacuuming their car and using up all the space. The meter gives a fairly accurate but not perfect PSI reading so you may want to buy a separate tire gauge. It has threaded ends to hold a tire nozzle securely. It comes with all kinds of end pieces so you could inflate a variety of things. I've had it for 6 months and check my tires monthly... Still going strong!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis L.

customer_reviews.title: Pumps fast and doesn’t give you a headache
customer_reviews.text: I was sick and tired of those bloody useless plastic inflators that plug into your 12v accessory port, making a huge noise while overheating, and never actually pumping your tire/tyre up even after 10 eat splitting minutes. Yes, I know you have to be at home or somewhere with a 110v outlet but this thing inflates really really fast. You really should buy the extra adapter that connects between this and the tyre valve. You’ll see it listed.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: and it's light enough and easy enough to use for him to manage on his ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a friend with a wheelchair, and it's light enough and easy enough to use for him to manage on his own. Fairly fast for low-volume tires, but it would take a while for an SUV or truck. But hey, that's not what it's really meant to do. It's even relatively quiet, compared to other oil-less compressors, though that's not saying a lot. You CAN speak in the same room with it, which is definitely better than most of the competition. We'll see how it holds up, but I expect it to work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Flyboyron

customer_reviews.title: Air line leaks right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: The blue air line leaked right out of the box at the brass connection point. Pulling it taut in a certain direction will stop the leak but the pump still took forever to get above 35 psi. I thought the Goodyear name will make it more reliable. Returning to Amazon and will try a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Trung L

customer_reviews.title: Unit can run by a work-around procedure.
customer_reviews.text: After charging the battery overnight, I tried to inflate tires. The unit wouldn't run on battery per instructions. I then connected to the car battery via the auxiliary line furnished and was successful in inflating a tire. Still can't operate directly from battery in normal mode. I now use the furnished aux. wire from the side of the unit and connect into the 12 v. plug (go around the battery switch) and I can use the installed battery. Not the intent of the design but it is the only way to make the unit work. Unit needs some work on reliability.
customer_reviews.author: Fred W. Fairchild

customer_reviews.title: Like others, I'm not exactly thrilled with the little ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use as a bicycle, motorcycle tire inflator to keep in my garage. It arrived on time from Amazon at a decent price point and I tested it on two bikes that day. All went well. Like others, I'm not exactly thrilled with the little screw-on air nozzle and would rather have the more traditional type. but it worked fine. Not as loud as the others I've used and did not get as hot. Pretty good for the money.
customer_reviews.author: NJ Shopper

customer_reviews.title: It works just fine
customer_reviews.text: The unit works just fine, the schraeder tire valve connector that's intergral to the system is a poor design as the plastic shroud that they put on slips around. I'll probably just cut it off and replace it eventually but the compressor inflated my trailer tires to 90 psi in a couple of minutes with no trouble whatsover.
customer_reviews.author: jonathan willy

customer_reviews.title: Much better than my little 12V compressor.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this pump. I have had it for a few months now and used it a number of times. I had a small 12V compressor that took forever to blow up even a bike tire and was ridiculously lod. This thing works very well on bike tires, balls, wheelbarrow tires, etc. I could imagine a car tire would take substantially longer unless you're just topping it off. The operation is pretty quiet, again much quieter than the 12V unit I have. Can't think of any negatives at this point. Maybe if it had a way to mount it on a wall.
customer_reviews.author: Prince26

customer_reviews.title: Great Portable Air Pump
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband as a gift. We have a camper and he wanted something that we could take with us when we travel that doesn't need electricity. The first one we received did not work (worked for about 3 minutes, then quit), but they quickly sent me a replacement and it works great! His father also has this pump, has had it for several years and is quite happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Great little device
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a cheap, reliable machine to pump up my motorcycle Tires. This was the best quality I could find (base on reviews) for the price I could find- including going into stores like Sears, Lowes, Home depot and Pep Boys. Like other said, not sure how accurate the gauge is, but I simply needed something to get me in the ball park of my goal (45psi). It did so without any problems. Would recommend if you need an light weight pump that gets you around what you need without a fuss.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Woodhouse

customer_reviews.title: Inflated 5 tires over 18 months and caught on fire
customer_reviews.text: Avoid this pump. Over the course of two years this pump was used sparingly to inflate 5 tires and babied keep in its original box out of the elements, then today the pump literally caught fire after a few minutes use. Glad I was standing there and not removing the other tire valve caps. Avoid this pump.
customer_reviews.author: J. Vance

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I don't use this to pump up car tires (though I probably should) so I can't speak to that. I bought this for really two purposes--1. to blow up my air mattress and 2. to put air in my bike tires. It does both with one machine, and pretty quickly. It does make a fair amount of noise, so I try to pump stuff up during the day out of respect for my neighbors. Despite that, this is one of my smarter buys. I no longer have to sit there for 20 minutes, pumping my arms like crazy to get my tires full.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Smith

customer_reviews.title: Under Powered
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for household use. Filling up bike and car tires, air mattresses, pool floats etc.. I haven't been able to get it to work with any tires (may be I was too impatient and expected it to work faster) and marginally for air mattresses. Pool floats were a breeze. Have to hold it in place for well over 30 minutes during which time it gets so hot that it burns you (even the plastic air coil). I would not recommend this product to anyone. Really wish I purchased something stronger/faster.
customer_reviews.author: Gore

customer_reviews.title: Did not make it through one tire inflation
customer_reviews.text: I read reviews, which averaged pretty decently for a cheap portable inflator, but mine was a fail. I hooked it up to a partially deflated car tire and set it to work. The box says it'll inflate a tire 0-28psi in 2.5 minutes. I waited for over 10 minutes and it still wasn't done. I noticed it was getting quite hot, which the instructions say is normal, but after a bit it began running very slowly, so I turned it off. I waited until it had cooled, and tried again, but this time, it would not power on at all. Back it goes! I'm going to explore a much better (and heavier) compressor for my next try.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Ritter

customer_reviews.title: I was ready to not like this pump because I thought that it was missing ...
customer_reviews.text: I was ready to not like this pump because I thought that it was missing the tire air chuck..... Actually, you screw the hose directly on to the tire valve stem. Then I was ready to not like it because I figured that the tire would deflate while I was unscrewing the hose. I was wrong. This thing is very nice. Plenty of air flow, and not overly loud.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working first day of use after a few minutes
customer_reviews.text: First used for about 10 minutes to inflate a van tire from 60# to 80#. So far so good. Then I started to inflate the opposite side tire. This inflator shut off after about 7 minutes, and would not turn on again even after I let it cool down. Could not find a fuse or circuit breaker to reset. Returned it for Amazon credit. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: vectorizer

customer_reviews.title: Very handy to have
customer_reviews.text: I love, love, love this little fellow! He's so handy to have and works like a charm. So easy for me to use. No more wrestling with the gas station air hose for me. This does just the job for me, to put some air in the tires from time to time. And he's easy to use too. Very good quality product as well. I'm very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Driggers

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product. Included hardware won't work on tires
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product. Included hardware won't work on tires. Tried to use my tire inflator but the 1/4 inch coupling is too small (3/8 is too big). Must be some weird metric size. Save your money. Go to the local hardware store and buy something that works.
customer_reviews.author: pedro Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: excellent pump.
customer_reviews.text: This is excellent! Inflates a tire quickly and accurately! Well built. I would caution some people that on older cars (think mid 90's and before) this may continually blow a fuse as it draws a lot of amps. So it really depends on which car you plug it into. I also noticed that the 12 volt plug gets very warm during continuous use (i.e. more than one tire or item). This includes a carrying case and some extra pins for beach balls, basketballs, just balls in general. Very nice pump with some accessories for a good price. I highly recommend it after a long ownership!
customer_reviews.author: TheJ as

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate and poorly made
customer_reviews.text: The plastic collar over the end was loose and broke within 10 seconds. The pressure gauge is about 10psi low. I have an accurate pressure gauge. When the Goodyear pump indicated 40psi, the more accurate gauge indicated 32psi. What good is a tire pump that you can't believe is accurate?
customer_reviews.author: Koeppel

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended!!
customer_reviews.text: This is very noisy so I don't see how they claim its super quiet. After running it for a few minutes my ears were still ringing for quite a while after. It also doesn't inflate very fast and it heats up so much that you can't touch many of the parts. Oh and the plastic attachment accessories are useless. They all leak and even if you can get it to hold, you have to hold your thumb over the deflate hole on the adapter in order to use them. How dumb. I'm returning it and I wouldn't recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: networkguy

customer_reviews.title: 1-16-19-24th Month Anniversary Review
customer_reviews.text: This is the second "120-Volt Direct Drive Tire Inflator" I have purchased. They were identical except the brand name. Either the Chinese manufacturer just installed different brand names or they are very good imitators. In the two years I've owned THIS pump I've probably used it 6 or 7 times. It produces slow pumping pressure. Today I started smelling electric burn. So it's probably shot too. That's about $2.00/month. I will definately choose a totally new design. This review in no way reflects the quality of the seller or Amazon. Both parties have done their jobs well.
customer_reviews.author: John Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Pump seized
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this a few months ago and ran it briefly to inflate bike tires to 90 psi and it worked wonderfully. Unfortunately when I used it to fill a 5gal portable air tank the pump seized while pushing about 60psi for a couple minutes. It won’t start anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to air up beach balls and a 5ft inflatable palm tree at a conference. It came with several attachments and I couldn't figure out what went where. The directions weren't very clear. But my guesstimate worked and I was able to get done what I needed. Based on my use, I would say it's best for blowing up small items (rafts, balls, bike tires, air mattress). I don't think it has enough power to air up a car tire. Four stars because the directions of putting together weren't clear, and I don't think it could inflate a car tire.
customer_reviews.author: Lnzee

customer_reviews.title: This inflator comes with little attachments to blow up smaller items like footballs too
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because the Casey's around the corner from my house has a perpetually broken air pump. It's broke more than it works. This inflator comes with little attachments to blow up smaller items like footballs too. This item has come in handy time & time again as I work in the middle of nowhere & of course that's when I'm going to have a low tire. I had a almost completely flat tire on my Malibu & in about 3-4 minutes it was completely inflated. For a woman who couldn't change a flat tire if my life depended on it, I am so grateful I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Keckler

customer_reviews.title: Good unit
customer_reviews.text: Had bought this unit to replace a tire inflator that I had alarm for 20 years. When I first opened this unit I mistakenly thought that it was not able to refill bicycle tires and I was quite upset because that’s the reason I bought it. After further investigation I found out that this can certainly pump up your bicycle tires as well as your automobile tires and this is been a great unit
customer_reviews.author: bbman

customer_reviews.title: Robust but watch out for leaking plastic hose.
customer_reviews.text: The coiled plastic supply hose developed a leak the first time I used it [could be temporarily fixed with a tape patch]. Amazon replaced the unit immediately. I chose this one, even though I was skeptical of the hose, because the pumping mechanism appeared more robust than the other AC units.The replacement unit didn't leak. Not a paid reviewer.
customer_reviews.author: E. Benz

customer_reviews.title: If you need a good air pump
customer_reviews.text: This is totally worth it! If you need a good air pump, spend the extra money and get one that works! This one TOTALLY works! I originally bought a cheaper pump to inflate ATV tires. It broke quickly, and wasn't powerful enough to work. This one worked so well! My ONLY complaint is there were no directions as to how to hook up the various parts. They are described in the literature, but no description of how to attach. Thankfully, I am relatively handy and figured it out, but for those who might be less mechanically inclined, that is my only complaint.
customer_reviews.author: dbkr

customer_reviews.title: Wish I bought sooner
customer_reviews.text: Great little pump. It's small & light, the hose has a long reach, it's relatively quiet, and it fills much faster than similar ones I've owned. The gauge is easy to read and accurate. The screw-on connector lets a lot less air to escape when connecting/disconnecting than the flip lever type. Much easier to attached to motorcycles with hard-to-reach valves. Very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This works great, ignore the dumb dumbs that can't figure out that you have to connect the tire connector to the tire first then hook up to the compressor - geez bad reviews from people that can't figure out how to tie their shoes.
customer_reviews.author: JAC

customer_reviews.title: Does not do what it says it should
customer_reviews.text: I bought this brand name 110 volt compressor because I needed it to work reliably to fill my pickup truck tires and fifth wheel trailer tires to 100 lb. This thing says it will produce 150 lb but it has let me down. The first time I needed to use it along the Alaska Highway it fail to exceed 75 lb. Chinese junk!
customer_reviews.author: Fishinfool

customer_reviews.title: Great Support
customer_reviews.text: The unit I received from Amazon did not auto cutoff. I called the manufacturer (name & number on the machine), explained what the problem was and asked for advice. What I got completely floored me - I got no excuses, objections, or other 'normal' BS. What I did get was a: "We'll send a replacement to you - what address shall we use - just discard the bad one!!" Great service, the replacement was here within the week and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Pecan Bob

customer_reviews.title: Works Nicely With Some Learning Curve
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I'm just inexperienced using such things, but when I got it out of the box and surveyed all the parts and attachments, and a really pathetically skimpy set of instructions, I was actually somewhat baffled and intimidated by this thing. It took me quite some time to come to grok how to use it, and when I did it was actually pretty easy. I got my car tires inflated to the proper levels in just a few minutes. Very handy device. I just wished they would "dumb down" the instructions a bit for first-timers like me.
customer_reviews.author: MovieGuyTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: A well made inflator with numerous accessories at a fair price.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the fact that the inflator was quiet and had a fairly accurate air pressure gauge. I also like the screw on connection to the tire valve as opposed to a clamp on mandril. However, I did have a bit of difficulty with the plastic sleeve that fits over the metal ferrule that screws onto the tire valve(the sleeve is there to keep you from burning your fingers). The sleeve kept wanting to slide forward, disengaging from the metal ferrule that it drives. There is probably a bit of a learning curve on my part still.
customer_reviews.author: Edward G. Ennis

customer_reviews.title: Malfunction
customer_reviews.text: Item failed, ran for about 7 to 8 minutes, then stopped. It was hot but I did not run continuously for 10 minutes Would not start after cooling off. This occurred on 14 Aug.
customer_reviews.author: Story C. Stevens

customer_reviews.title: If you're only filling tires with air, buy a cheap disposible oil-less compressor instead.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about a year or approximately 20 uses. Then the piston seal failed and the pump no longer was able to increase pressure beyond about 10lbs. I disassembled the pump and found the piston ring had failed, rendering compression impossible. Although it is an oil-less compressor, it shouldn't have failed after 20 uses. I paid 50.00 for this product. Since then I have determined that filling tires can be done with a disposable cheap compressor which will also fail but cost under 20.00 dollars. That's the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: William Rutledge

customer_reviews.title: WOW!!! Great Product!!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased and tried multiple "inexpensive" air compressors, and have been unhappy with all of them - mainly with the "new design" tire fitting connectors. This compressor had the "old-style" screw-on connector (why they went away from that I'll never know). This make it easy to connect to the tires. But the MAIN positive is the compressor capacity - the other units took forever to inflate a tire, and you had to turn some of them off to see the tire pressure. This one inflates quickly, and give you a continuous pressure reading. I am VERY pleased with the product!!
customer_reviews.author: Robert W. Graper

customer_reviews.title: Throw away the plastic knob on the business end of the inflation hose
customer_reviews.text: It's a good product. However the plastic knob meant to go on the end of the inflation hose is useless when inflating tires. It spins ineffectively before the connection to the tire is air tight, bleeding the tire of the pressure already in it. Fortunately, if you remove it, the knurled brass connector underneath affords sufficient grip to effect a seal for those with average finger strength.
customer_reviews.author: someotherguy

customer_reviews.title: an early failure
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this inflator on Feb. 14, 2019 and received it on Feb. 19. I used it to inflate several tires that were low by a few psi. over the course of 6 weeks. On Mar. 28, I put a few psi in a tire and turned it off 2 psi from the final reading I wanted to let it cool per mfg. instructions. When it cooled, I turned it back on to finish the job. It made a slight buzzing sound and didn't run. It hasn't run since. I hope the selling co. will replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Wolf Alaska

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk
customer_reviews.text: Ignored a few bad reviews thinking they might be just a anomaly. NOPE. Bought to fill my pickup truck tires after getting off the beach in NJ. Used once. Went to use a second time. NOTHING. Not sure what happened. Trying to return. I also spent 30 bucks putting a better hose system on since the hose it came with was a complete piece of crap. Do not purchase.
customer_reviews.author: the43k

customer_reviews.title: The screw on hose end is both good and bad
customer_reviews.text: Works well for light use. I use this mainly for the tires on my riding mower and bike, but have used it for truck tires as well. It is fairly loud. The screw on hose end is both good and bad. When you have easy access to the valve stem, I really like that it screws on for a secure fit. On my riding mower, the valve stem is on the back side of the tire and getting the hose screwed on can be a slight pain. The built in air pressure gauge is a definite plus.
customer_reviews.author: T. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Does a fine job
customer_reviews.text: A little slow but does a fine job of filling a car tire. Much more powerful than the 12 V air pumps. I like the screw on valve connector. It makes a solid connection. Cam lock connectors can be leaky. I was worried it would exceed the 10 minute duty cycle topping up four tires and a spare but it got just barely warm. With the disappearance of gas station air pumps, I can't imagine being without one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Mike in AL

customer_reviews.title: Need to put air in stuff? Use this!
customer_reviews.text: Really nice option for tire inflation. I wanted to keep my tires at the right inflation but hated having to find a gas station! This unit is really small, easy to use, the gauge appears to be accurate. AND you can use it on blow up pools too! Comes with a slew of adapters.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasted*sigh*!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this inflator January 2015. Due to my tire pressure light coming on during these brutal mid west winter temperatures, having easy access to a tire inflator on my Jeep was very convenient! Well it's September and the temperatures have dropped and my tire pressure light came on and when I hooked my trusty inflator onto my tire it failed. It lasted only a season
customer_reviews.author: Jae Dub

customer_reviews.title: Psi reading not accurate
customer_reviews.text: Had atleast 7 small portable air compressors in the past and this one is definitely not the best one. You have to really tighten the hose and steam connection to get air inside of tire and the psi reading is always off. It looks really nice and I like the flexibility in the hose.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: So much better than my DC car pump.
customer_reviews.text: A bit louder than I expected, but it does it's job so quickly that it's not a problem. Wish the gauge was at the end of the hose instead of on the pump. Doesn't make sense to have a long hose if it's going to be too far away to read the gauge. I wish there was a simple push on connector in addition to screw on. If I'm only adding a few pounds of pressure to my tires, it actually takes more time to screw it on/off the valve stem than it does to inflate.The pump is on rubber feet that keep it from dancing itself around.
customer_reviews.author: It's a me, Mario!

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, medium execution
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of a battery powered, auto shut-off tire inflator/compressor. There is room for improvement tho. A) Both of the fuses that came with it blew when I tried to pump up my tires. Best I can figure is that its because the tires were almost at the set pressure when I turned the i5000 on, and it overloaded and blew. So I bought some standard fuses from the store and now it works like a charm! I think the ones that come with it are just poor quality. B) The storage compartment is way too small. I have to fight it to keep a couple extra fuses in there (see above problem). Otherwise, great product, very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: AW

customer_reviews.title: Only one drawback
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my dad. The only thing he doesn’t like about it is you have to screw the hose onto the valve stem, it isn’t they typical put it on and flip the lever. This usually isn’t a big deal, but he is older and it is tougher for him to screw it on.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Goodyear Tire Pump
customer_reviews.text: Goodyear tire pump, item came before stated time and in new condition. Function, this pump inflates all 4 tires on my vehicle in the time my old 12 volt DC pump took to do 1 tire.. The gauge on the pump is as accurate as my tire gauge - build quality is good - comes with a bunch of attachments and the coil hose is quick disconnect - overall I am impressed with the quality and performance of this pump - would recommend to anyone.. 3.22.2015 - This pump still works after taking an amazing beating - from small passenger car tires to truck tires this pump has been used and used a lot - still working great!
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent multi-tasker
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like having to use a car's outlet to power our old air compressor, so I was on the hunt. This product appealed to me because of it's "needle" attachment, which I've been using with success to clean off electronic components with dust buildup. Cans of air aren't cheap anymore ($6 per can, locally), so this ended up being a pretty solid cost-saver. I imagine it'd be unfortunate to fall on the needle while the compressor's on, however.... With a portable power supply or extension cord, could be a reasonable self-defense weapon if you're looking to be unorthodox. Step aside, Anton Chigurh.
customer_reviews.author: klu

customer_reviews.title: great for autos and small items that need inflating
customer_reviews.text: I use it for my bike tires and it does the job but I also purchased a separate air loss tire pressure inflator attached it to this and it works great with less time inflating tires and no air loss. It hooks up to a wall outlet and not a cigarette lighter. I would recommend getting an extension cord for the wall outlet for more reach. The cord on this is very short. It comes with separate attachments for different air inflating usage. I would also recommend a tire pressure gauge since it does not come with one or one that comes attached with the tire inflator because this has an attachment for that.
customer_reviews.author: Minerva Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product for the money spent
customer_reviews.text: I intended to use this compressor to fill my motorcycle and car tires when needed. I have owned the product for 10 months and used it for the second time today. I had to give it breaks between each tire and it took forever to inflate the tires. Terrible product for the money spent!
customer_reviews.author: Christina fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Best 120 volt air pump I've ever had. I use it to keep tire pressures at optimum. Puts out a good volume at a good rate and doesn't get too hot. Not so loud as the others I've used, too. I'd recommend this without reservation.
customer_reviews.author: JMO

product_meta.title: Goodyear i8000 120-Volt Direct Drive Tire Inflator
product_meta.description: 120 Volley Multi-Purpose Inflator will inflate anything from car and truck tires to balls for any sport. All inclusive package includes 24 feet of air hose and power cord. Includes adapters to inflate hundreds of different products.
feature_bullets: 18 feet of air hose with quick connect valve and 6 foot power cord makes it extremely easy and hassle-free to reach all vehicle tires
powerful direct drive motor is extremely quite and virtually vibration free
includes adapters to inflates nearly anything
120 volt direct drive inflator with Whisper Soft technology provides extremely quiet and efficient operation
Includes inflation adaptors for all sporting equipment and rafts; plugs into any standard 120-volt wall outlet for power
Inflates P185/R14 from 0 - 28 PSI in approximately 2 1/2 minutes or less
1-feet rubber air hose, 17-feet PVC air hose with quick connect valve and 6-feet power cord for a total of 24 feet, makes it extremely easy and hassle-free to reach all vehicle tires
The maximum tire pressure is 150 PSI

specifications.Model: H/DUTY AIR COMPRESSOR DIRECT DRIVE - 120 VOLT - 2.5 MINUTE
specifications.Cover Included: Goodyear I8000 120-Volt Direct Drive Tire Inflator, Inflation Adaptors, Pvc Air Hose
specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars2,261 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
